title: Young woman filmed hurling friend's cat across garden into path of chasing dog

This shocking video shows a woman flinging a cat across a garden after it supposedly attacked her dogs.

Charli Gowland, from Wagga Wagga, New South Wales, Australia, has been charged with animal cruelty over the brutal act.

Footage of her allegedly launching the mog into the air was shared on Instagram by her pal Jamilla Pearcy.

In the video, a dog can be seen chasing the cat as it flies across the yard.

(Image: 7 News)

(Image: 7 News)

Gowland has since apologised for her actions and insists the pet is still alive, although a friend claims it is dead, reports say.

According to the Mail Online, a Wagga Wagga police officer said: "I have seen the video and it's absolutely disgraceful.

"We have zero tolerance for animal cruelty in this community.

(Image: 7 News)

(Image: Facebook)

"Apart from it being really distasteful and disgusting, I don't see why anyone would see a video like that being funny."

The video of the incident has gone viral, with many expressing disgust at the heartless act.

Some have also called for Ms Pearcy to face justice, condemning her for filming the savagery and uploading it to Instagram with the message 'caption this'.

(Image: Facebook)

(Image: Facebook)

It comes after Waylon Johncock was filmed stoning a wombat to death in south Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

Egged on by a friend, who was following him in a car and at one stage can be heard yelling "kill him!", the police officer chase the wombat along a dirt road, hammering it with rocks.

South Australian Police confirmed the man has been identified as a member of the force, adding the behaviour displayed does not align with its values and he has launched an investigation.
description: Australian police described the video as 'absolutely disgraceful' and said they had zero tolerance for animal cruelty
